com.fasterxml.util.membuf

    • Field Detail

      • _peekedEntry

        protected long[] _peekedEntry
        Segment that was peeked, if any. When entries are peeked, a copy of data is store in this property and actual contents are remove as if entry was read normally.

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Description copied from interface: MemBuffer
        Method for checking whether this buffer has no entries, functionally equivalent to: 
           getEntryCount() == 0
        Returns:
        True if this buffer contains no entries

      • getTotalPayloadLength

        public long getTotalPayloadLength()
        Description copied from interface: MemBuffer
        Method for checking total amount of payload buffered in this buffer. This does not include entry metadata (length prefixes), if any.
        Specified by:

      • appendEntry

        public final void appendEntry(long[] data)

      • appendEntry

        public final void appendEntry(long[] data,
               int dataOffset,
               int dataLength)
        Method that tries to append an entry in buffer and returning; if there is no room, a IllegalStateException is thrown.

      • tryAppendEntry

        public final boolean tryAppendEntry(long[] data)
        Method that tries to append an entry in buffer if there is enough room; if there is, entry is appended and 'true' returned; otherwise no changes are made and 'false' is returned.

      • tryAppendEntry

        public abstract boolean tryAppendEntry(long[] data,
                     int dataOffset,
                     int dataLength)
        Method that tries to append an entry in buffer if there is enough room; if there is, entry is appended and 'true' returned; otherwise no changes are made and 'false' is returned.

      • getNextEntryLength

        public abstract int getNextEntryLength()
        Method that will check size of the next entry, if buffer has entries; returns size in longs if there is at least one entry, or -1 if buffer is empty. Note that this method does not remove the entry and can be called multiple times, that is, it is fully idempotent.

      • getNextEntry

        public abstract long[] getNextEntry()
                             throws InterruptedException
        Method for reading and removing next available entry from buffer. If no entry is available, will block to wait for more data.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • getNextEntryIfAvailable

        public abstract long[] getNextEntryIfAvailable()
        Method that will read, remove and return next entry, if one is available; or return null if not.

      • getNextEntry

        public abstract long[] getNextEntry(long timeoutMsecs)
                             throws InterruptedException
        Method to get (and remove) next entry from the buffer, if one is available. If buffer is empty, may wait up to specified amount of time for new data to arrive.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMsecs - Amount of time to wait for more data if buffer is empty, if non-zero positive number; if zero or negative number, will return immediately
        Returns:
        Next entry from buffer, if one was available either immediately or before waiting for full timeout; or null if no entry became available
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • readNextEntry

        public abstract int readNextEntry(long[] buffer,
                int offset)
                           throws InterruptedException
        Method for reading and removing next available entry from buffer and return length of the entry in longs, if succesful; or, if buffer does not have enough space, return negative number as error code. If no entry is available, will block to wait for more data.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read: must have enough space for read to succeed
        offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
        Returns:
        Length of the entry (non-negative) if read succeeds; or, negative number that indicates length of the entry in case of failures: for example, if buffer only had space for 4 longs, and entry length was 6, would return -6.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • readNextEntryIfAvailable

        public abstract int readNextEntryIfAvailable(long[] buffer,
                           int offset)
        Method for reading and removing next available entry from buffer and return length of the entry in longs, if successful; or, if buffer does not have enough space, return negative number as error code. If no entry is available, will return Integer.MIN_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read: must have enough space for read to succeed
        offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
        Returns:
        Integer.MIN_VALUE if no entry was available, length of the entry (non-negative) read if read succeeds, or negative number that indicates length of the entry in case of failures: for example, if buffer only had space for 4 longs, and entry length was 6, would return -6.

      • readNextEntry

        public abstract int readNextEntry(long timeoutMsecs,
                long[] buffer,
                int offset)
                           throws InterruptedException
        Method for reading and removing next entry from the buffer, if one is available. If buffer is empty, may wait up to specified amount of time for new data to arrive. If no entry is available after timeout, will return Integer.MIN_VALUE. If length of entry exceeds available buffer space, will return negative number that indicates length of the entry that would have been copied.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMsecs - Amount of time to wait for more data if buffer is empty, if non-zero positive number; if zero or negative number, will return immediately
        buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read: must have enough space for read to succeed
        offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
        Returns:
        Integer.MIN_VALUE if no entry was available, length of the entry (non-negative) read if read succeeds, or negative number that indicates length of the entry in case of failures: for example, if buffer only had space for 4 longs, and entry length was 6, would return -6.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • skipNextEntry

        public int skipNextEntry()
        Description copied from interface: ChunkyMemBuffer
        Method that will skip the next entry from the buffer, if an entry is available, and return length of the skipped entry: if buffer is empty, will return -1
        Returns:
        Length of skipped entry, if buffer was not empty; -1 if buffer was empty

      • peekNextEntry

        public abstract long[] peekNextEntry()
        Method that will read, and return (but NOT remove) the next entry, if one is available; or return null if none available. Method is idempotent.

        Note that implementations may require additional storage for keeping track of recently peeked entry; for example, they may retain a long array copy of the contents separate from physical storage.
